definition: to inspect/to examine/to be aware/to pay a visit (to one's parents or elders)
to save/to economize/to do without/to omit/to leave out/province/(archaic) central government department

sentences.english: The man ran toward the emperor before falling unconscious to the ground, where he lay groaning.
sentences.chinese: 他徑直向皇帝跑來，但終於不省人事跌倒了。

sentences.english: Edina was unconscious for two hours after the accident.
sentences.chinese: 在事故發生後的兩個小時裏，愛丁娜一直不省人事。

sentences.english: Another man was poisoned after he drank an herbal tea brewed from the leaves of this plant.
sentences.chinese: 還有人喝了這種植物葉子釀造的花草茶後不省人事。

sentences.english: After three drinks, he passed out.
sentences.chinese: 酒過三巡，他醉得不省人事。

sentences.english: The recipe recipient transiently made the conscientious alien client unconscious.
sentences.chinese: 處方容器片刻使盡責的外國顧客不省人事。
安德烈將傑克痛扁直至其不省人事。

sentences.english: Within minutes, Terry’s unconscious body was picked up by 14)paramedics at the side of the road.
sentences.chinese: 很快，不省人事的特里被救護人員擡到了馬路一旁。

sentences.english: How long had I been unconscious?
sentences.chinese: 我這樣不省人事有多久了？

sentences.english: He was badly injured in the accident and still dead to the world now.
sentences.chinese: 他在事故中受了重傷，到現在仍不省人事。

sentences.english: Saved by others, she got seriously ill, almost unconscious for 40 more days.
sentences.chinese: 被人救起後，她大病40余天，幾乎不省人事。

sentences.english: As the whisky took effect, he gradually fell into a drunken stupor.
sentences.chinese: 隨着威士忌酒力發作，他逐漸醉得不省人事。

sentences.english: After three drinks, the man passed out.
sentences.chinese: 酒過三巡，他醉得不省人事。

definition: to be delirious/to be mentally confused
to lose consciousness/to be in a coma/stupor/coma/stunned/disoriented
to faint/to swoon/to black out/to become unconscious
dead drunk/as drunk as a lord
lit. as drunk as mud/completely drunk
variant of 醉醺醺[zui4 xun1 xun1]
